item.title: To designate a portion of the Rappahannock River in the State of Virginia as the "John W. Warner Rapids".

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

item.title: An original bill to designate a portion of the Rappahannock River in the Commonwealth of Virginia as the "John W. Warner Rapids".

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S8416)

item.title: S. 3482, A bill to designate a portion of the Rappahannock River in the Commonwealth of Virginia as the "John W. Warner Rapids"
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works on September 17, 2008

item.title: S. 3482, A bill to designate a portion of the Rappahannock River in the Commonwealth of Virginia as the "John W. Warner Rapids"
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works on September 17, 2008

item.text: For further action, see S.3550, which became Public Law 110-418 on 10/14/2008.

summary.text: Designates a portion of the Rappahannock River comprised of the manmade rapids located at the site of the former Embrey Dam in Fredericksburg, Virginia, as the John W. Warner Rapids.

bill.title: A bill to designate a portion of the Rappahannock River in the Commonwealth of Virginia as the "John W. Warner Rapids".

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
